title: 4D Reconstructions for Bronchoscopies
desc: We created a synthetic dataset of bronchoscopic videos in dynamically breathing lung models and designed a 4D reconstruction pipeline that leverages geometric deformation cues and temporal alignment, delivering smoother airway surface reconstructions with improved temporal fidelity over existing methods.

title: Improving Endoscopic SLAM with NFL-BA
desc: NFL-BA augments dense visual SLAM for endoscopy by integrating near-field lighting cues into the bundle adjustment objective, improving pose tracking accuracy by about 30% and achieving state-of-the-art results on the C3VD dataset.

title: Controllable Sim-to-Real Translation for Colonoscopy Depth Estimation
desc: PPS-Ctrl conditions a Stable Diffusion model with ControlNet on Per-Pixel Shading representations to enforce lighting-consistent structure, producing more photorealistic sim-to-real colonoscopy translations and enhancing depth estimation accuracy over prior approaches.

title: Next-Best-View Selection for Resource-Efficient 3D Reconstruction
desc: Our View Inference Network encodes partial 3D reconstructions and predicts the most informative next viewpoints, improving reconstruction quality by roughly 30% compared to coverage-based baselines under acquisition and motion constraints.

title: Leveraging 3D Features for Multi-modal Task Proficiency Estimation
desc: Using the Ego-Exo 4D dataset’s synchronized videos, audio, and point clouds, we train transformer models on 3D body-pose embeddings and apply commentary-guided key-clip selection, yielding 3–5% gains over baselines and an extra 15% when incorporating expert commentary.

title: Reinforcement Learning for the Toyota HSR
desc: We build Gazebo/OpenAI Gym environments for the Toyota HSR and apply reinforcement learning with temporal-logic constraints, yielding policies that reliably satisfy assistive-task specifications and safety requirements on the robot platform.

title: Online Learning for Multi-Label Medical Images
desc: We extend CNN architectures with stability-enhancing update rules and dynamic sampling to tackle highly imbalanced multi-label medical image streams in an online learning setting, maintaining accuracy and robustness during continuous model updates.

title: Modulation of TTBK1 and TTBK2 Impacts Ciliogenesis
desc: Combining immunofluorescent staining with AI-powered image analysis and automated ImageJ macros, we quantify cilia count and length across hundreds of images to reveal distinct effects of TTBK1 versus TTBK2 on ciliogenesis and streamline high-throughput studies.

title: BAZ2/BRD9 Bromodomain Inhibitor Induces Apoptosis in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
desc: By applying bromodomain inhibitors to triple-negative breast cancer cell lines and using Western blotting, gel electrophoresis, DNA plasmid preps, and microscopy, we demonstrate effective induction of apoptosis, informing epigenetic therapy strategies in BRCA2-mutant contexts.
